instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message:
I’m working on a [URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL] that had some minor liquid damage, already changed sensor on pbus vp0r and some bad looking components on this region.

Fans are running a bit higher than normal and it’s sluggish and beach balling for everything.

what would be normal readings for PBUS VP0R?

ASD EFI not showing any errors too

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message:
Working battery connected? EFI reporting no errors with and without charger connected?
Look up sensor readings for VP0R and VD0R in the ASD  hardware profile.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message: Any toughs on this? It sometimes show some errors on ASD about palmrest sensor and ambient temperature, but last time wasn't giving any errors

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Gustavo Gomes, post: 33032"]Any toughs on this? It sometimes show some errors on ASD about palmrest sensor and ambient temperature, but last time wasn't giving any errors[/QUOTE]

<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> are super common areas for liquid to hit. Any liquid in the SMC area? Intermittent errors I would think crap under the SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message: Need the exact sensor name like TA0P, also the error reading high/low or IO error. It could very well be crap under the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message:
Errors on EFI ASD:

TA0P ambient air- SMC IO failed
TC0P cpu proximity- SMC IO failed
TM0P memory proximity- SMC IO failed
Th1H fin stack test 1- SMC IO failed

Errors on OS ASD:

Chipset: Dmi Error Check - PCi driver IOServices open error
TA0P ambient air- SMC Cannot read sensor
TC0P cpu proximity- SMC Cannot read sensor
TM0P memory proximity- SMC Cannot read sensor
Th1H fin stack test 1- SMC Cannot read sensor
SATA Pci Register Test- Pci Driver IOServices open error

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message: <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> issue. Check power to chip, <RESISTOR>R5510</RESISTOR> suspect. Corrosion around/under <CHIP>U5511</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message:
Changed <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> just in case, no corrosion around or under.
It gest its 3v.

Now it wont get backlight, working on this now and get back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message: diode mode on both data lines from <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> (pins 9-10)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow and mouse lagging, liquid damage
threads.message: Voltage on pin 1,7,8 of <CHIP>U5511</CHIP>, if all 3v then ok. It could also be crap under the SMC or dead SMC. Reflow SMC first with some flux and about 150C, do not melt the solder. Just heat it up to clear the crap under the SMC.
